title: Acronyms
data:
A list of acronyms, initialisms and abbreviations of the NetHack community. Also look in [Category:Acronyms](/wiki/Category:Acronyms "Category:Acronyms"). For nicknames and item class abbreviations like "?oGD" for "[scroll of gold detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_gold_detection "Scroll of gold detection")", see [Abbreviations](/wiki/Abbreviations "Abbreviations").

- [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"): *armor class* – Usually called AC, and displayed as AC on the status line.

- [AoY](/wiki/AoY "AoY") or "oY: *Amulet of Yendor* – Everyone wants it. Also called "the Amulet". The [cheap plastic imitation](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitation_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor "Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor") is a "fake AoY" or "fake Amulet".

- [ASCII](/wiki/ASCII "ASCII"): *American Standard Code for Information Interchange* – The character set from which NetHack finds those map symbols.

- [BSD](/wiki/BSD "BSD"): *Berkeley System Distribution* – Once a popular operating system for the VAX machine, and the original platform for NetHack. Today "BSD" refers to the modern variants of the original BSD.

- [BDSM](/wiki/BDSM "BDSM"): Probably an attempt to refer to black (or blue) dragon scale mail, in analogy to GSDM and SDSM. In non-NetHack contexts, or in certain jokes about nymphs or foocubi, BDSM may be an initialism of "bondage, domination, sadism, masochism".

- [DSM](/wiki/DSM "DSM"): *dragon scale mail* – Without the color, if you remove the first letter from GDSM or SDSM.

- [DYWYPI](/wiki/DYWYPI "DYWYPI"): *Do you want your possesions identified?* – The familiar message from the end of your game. Writing "DYWYPI?" is a way to imply that the hero died.

- [E](/wiki/E "E"): *[Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth")* – In contexts like "Engrave E" or "Why didn't you E?", especially in [IRC](/wiki/IRC "IRC") where participants remain too lazy to type Her name.

- [FAQ](/wiki/FAQ "FAQ"): *frequently asked questions* – Many Usenet groups, including RGRN, periodically post a FAQ to explain the group.

- [GDSM](/wiki/GDSM "GDSM"): *gray dragon scale mail* – Non-metal armor that provides good AC and magic resistance. Frequent wish, along with SDSM.

- [GoD](/wiki/GoD "GoD") or \[oD: *gauntlets of dexterity* – Sometimes an alternative to gauntlets of power in ascension kits.

- [GoP](/wiki/GoP "GoP") or \[oP: *gauntlets of power* – Common item in ascension kits, for boosting strength to 25.

- [IRC](/wiki/IRC "IRC"): *Internet Relay Chat* – Online chat, divided into rooms called channels. Libera has a #nethack channel for spoily discussion.

- [LRS](/wiki/LRS "LRS"): *Larn Revenue Service* – NetHack mentions the LRS when you try to drop or throw a negative amount of gold.

- [NGPL](/wiki/NGPL "NGPL"): *NetHack General Public License* – Usually refers to the template {{[NGPL](/wiki/Template:NGPL "Template:NGPL")}} on this wiki.

- [NH](/wiki/NH "NH"): *NetHack*

- [NHINRL](/wiki/NHINRL "NHINRL"): *NetHack is not real life* – Explanation for why NetHack does not always follow the physics of the real world.

- [PYEC](/wiki/PYEC "PYEC"): *the Platinum Yendorian Express Card* – Tourist's quest artifact, and popular wish for other neutral characters who want to add charges to items.

- [RGRN](/wiki/RGRN "RGRN") or [rgrn](/wiki/Rgrn "Rgrn"): *rec.games.roguelike.nethack* – The game's discussion group on Usenet.

- RL: *real life* or *roguelike* – Usually in the phrase NHINRL. Some other roguelike games have RL in their names.

- S or S'EM: *[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM")* – An "S" in the subject line of RGRN posts may indicate that the post is about SLASH'EM.

- [SDSM](/wiki/SDSM "SDSM"): *silver dragon scale mail* – Non-metal armor that provides good AC and reflection. Frequent wish, along with GDSM.

- [TDTTOE](/wiki/TDTTOE "TDTTOE"): *The DevTeam Thinks of Everything* – The expression for when you try something strange in NetHack, and the game reacts appropriately.

- [unihorn](/wiki/Unihorn "Unihorn"): *unicorn horn* – Important cure. A cursed unihorn is unhelpful for that, but a spare unihorn may help.

- [WoW](/wiki/WoW "WoW") or /oW: *wand of wishing* – Everyone wants this. The WoW in the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle") is usually termed the "castle wand".

- [WoY](/wiki/WoY "WoY"): *Wizard of Yendor* – More frequently terms for him are "[Rodney](/wiki/Rodney "Rodney")" or "the Wizard". The WoY wants the AoY.

- YA...: *yet another...*

  - [YAAD](/wiki/YAAD "YAAD"): *Yet Another Annoying Death* – Alternative to YASD, when the annoyed player blames the game, not a player's mistake, for the death of the hero.
  - [YAAP](/wiki/YAAP "YAAP"): *Yet Another Ascension Post* – A post to [RGRN](/wiki/RGRN "RGRN") announcing that a player won the game.
  - [YAFAP](/wiki/YAFAP "YAFAP"): *Yet Another First Ascension Post* – A post to RGRN announcing a player's first win.
  - [YAFM](/wiki/YAFM "YAFM"): *Yet Another Funny Message* – Because you did not expect the message, but [TDTTOE](/wiki/TDTTOE "TDTTOE").
  - [YANC](/wiki/YANC "YANC"): *Yet Another Newt Comic* – A *[Dudley's dungeon](/wiki/Dudley%27s_dungeon "Dudley's dungeon")* strip in which a [newt](/wiki/Newt "Newt") appears and scares (and usually kills) Dudley.
  - [YANI](/wiki/YANI "YANI"): *Yet Another New Idea* – A muse to add some feature to NetHack.
  - [YASD](/wiki/YASD "YASD"): *Yet Another Stupid Death* – A mistake that causes the death of the hero.
html:
Acronyms

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

A list of acronyms, initialisms and abbreviations of the NetHack community. Also look in Category:Acronyms. For nicknames and item class abbreviations like "?oGD" for "scroll of gold detection", see Abbreviations.

  • AC: armor class – Usually called AC, and displayed as AC on the status line.
  • AoY or "oY: Amulet of Yendor – Everyone wants it. Also called "the Amulet". The cheap plastic imitation is a "fake AoY" or "fake Amulet".
  • ASCII: American Standard Code for Information Interchange – The character set from which NetHack finds those map symbols.
  • BSD: Berkeley System Distribution – Once a popular operating system for the VAX machine, and the original platform for NetHack. Today "BSD" refers to the modern variants of the original BSD.
  • BDSM: Probably an attempt to refer to black (or blue) dragon scale mail, in analogy to GSDM and SDSM. In non-NetHack contexts, or in certain jokes about nymphs or foocubi, BDSM may be an initialism of "bondage, domination, sadism, masochism".
  • DSM: dragon scale mail – Without the color, if you remove the first letter from GDSM or SDSM.
  • DYWYPI: Do you want your possesions identified? – The familiar message from the end of your game. Writing "DYWYPI?" is a way to imply that the hero died.
  • E: Elbereth – In contexts like "Engrave E" or "Why didn't you E?", especially in IRC where participants remain too lazy to type Her name.
  • FAQ: frequently asked questions – Many Usenet groups, including RGRN, periodically post a FAQ to explain the group.
  • GDSM: gray dragon scale mail – Non-metal armor that provides good AC and magic resistance. Frequent wish, along with SDSM.
  • GoD or [oD: gauntlets of dexterity – Sometimes an alternative to gauntlets of power in ascension kits.
  • GoP or [oP: gauntlets of power – Common item in ascension kits, for boosting strength to 25.
  • IRC: Internet Relay Chat – Online chat, divided into rooms called channels. Libera has a #nethack channel for spoily discussion.
  • LRS: Larn Revenue Service – NetHack mentions the LRS when you try to drop or throw a negative amount of gold.
  • NGPL: NetHack General Public License – Usually refers to the template {{NGPL}} on this wiki.
  • NH: NetHack
  • NHINRL: NetHack is not real life – Explanation for why NetHack does not always follow the physics of the real world.
  • PYEC: the Platinum Yendorian Express Card – Tourist's quest artifact, and popular wish for other neutral characters who want to add charges to items.
  • RGRN or rgrn: rec.games.roguelike.nethack – The game's discussion group on Usenet.
  • RL: real life or roguelike – Usually in the phrase NHINRL. Some other roguelike games have RL in their names.
  • S or S'EM: SLASH'EM – An "S" in the subject line of RGRN posts may indicate that the post is about SLASH'EM.
  • SDSM: silver dragon scale mail – Non-metal armor that provides good AC and reflection. Frequent wish, along with GDSM.
  • TDTTOE: The DevTeam Thinks of Everything – The expression for when you try something strange in NetHack, and the game reacts appropriately.
  • unihorn: unicorn horn – Important cure. A cursed unihorn is unhelpful for that, but a spare unihorn may help.
  • WoW or /oW: wand of wishing – Everyone wants this. The WoW in the Castle is usually termed the "castle wand".
  • WoY: Wizard of Yendor – More frequently terms for him are "Rodney" or "the Wizard". The WoY wants the AoY.
  • YA...: yet another...
    • YAAD: Yet Another Annoying Death – Alternative to YASD, when the annoyed player blames the game, not a player's mistake, for the death of the hero.
    • YAAP: Yet Another Ascension Post – A post to RGRN announcing that a player won the game.
    • YAFAP: Yet Another First Ascension Post – A post to RGRN announcing a player's first win.
    • YAFM: Yet Another Funny Message – Because you did not expect the message, but TDTTOE.
    • YANC: Yet Another Newt Comic – A Dudley's dungeon strip in which a newt appears and scares (and usually kills) Dudley.
    • YANI: Yet Another New Idea – A muse to add some feature to NetHack.
    • YASD: Yet Another Stupid Death – A mistake that causes the death of the hero.

rawPage:
A list of acronyms, initialisms and abbreviations of the NetHack community. Also look in [[:Category:Acronyms]]. For nicknames and item class abbreviations like "?oGD" for "[[scroll of gold detection]]", see [[Abbreviations]].

* [[AC]]: ''armor class'' – Usually called AC, and displayed as AC on the status line.
* [[AoY]] or "oY: ''Amulet of Yendor'' – Everyone wants it. Also called "the Amulet". The [[cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor|cheap plastic imitation]] is a "fake AoY" or "fake Amulet".
* [[ASCII]]: ''American Standard Code for Information Interchange'' – The character set from which NetHack finds those map symbols.
* [[BSD]]: ''Berkeley System Distribution'' – Once a popular operating system for the VAX machine, and the original platform for NetHack. Today "BSD" refers to the modern variants of the original BSD.
* [[BDSM]]: Probably an attempt to refer to black (or blue) dragon scale mail, in analogy to GSDM and SDSM. In non-NetHack contexts, or in certain jokes about nymphs or foocubi, BDSM may be an initialism of "bondage, domination, sadism, masochism".
* [[DSM]]: ''dragon scale mail'' – Without the color, if you remove the first letter from GDSM or SDSM.
* [[DYWYPI]]: ''Do you want your possesions identified?'' – The familiar message from the end of your game. Writing "DYWYPI?" is a way to imply that the hero died.
* [[E]]: ''[[Elbereth]]'' – In contexts like "Engrave E" or "Why didn't you E?", especially in [[IRC]] where participants remain too lazy to type Her name.
* [[FAQ]]: ''frequently asked questions'' – Many Usenet groups, including RGRN, periodically post a FAQ to explain the group.
* [[GDSM]]: ''gray dragon scale mail'' – Non-metal armor that provides good AC and magic resistance. Frequent wish, along with SDSM.
* [[GoD]] or [oD: ''gauntlets of dexterity'' – Sometimes an alternative to gauntlets of power in ascension kits.
* [[GoP]] or [oP: ''gauntlets of power'' – Common item in ascension kits, for boosting strength to 25.
* [[IRC]]: ''Internet Relay Chat'' – Online chat, divided into rooms called channels. Libera has a #nethack channel for spoily discussion.
* [[LRS]]: ''Larn Revenue Service'' – NetHack mentions the LRS when you try to drop or throw a negative amount of gold.
* [[NGPL]]: ''NetHack General Public License'' – Usually refers to the template {{tl|NGPL}} on this wiki.
* [[NH]]: ''NetHack''
* [[NHINRL]]: ''NetHack is not real life'' – Explanation for why NetHack does not always follow the physics of the real world.
* [[PYEC]]: ''the Platinum Yendorian Express Card'' – Tourist's quest artifact, and popular wish for other neutral characters who want to add charges to items.
* [[RGRN]] or [[rgrn]]: ''rec.games.roguelike.nethack'' – The game's discussion group on Usenet.
* RL: ''real life'' or ''roguelike'' – Usually in the phrase NHINRL. Some other roguelike games have RL in their names.
* S or S'EM: ''[[SLASH'EM]]'' – An "S" in the subject line of RGRN posts may indicate that the post is about SLASH'EM.
* [[SDSM]]: ''silver dragon scale mail'' – Non-metal armor that provides good AC and reflection. Frequent wish, along with GDSM.
* [[TDTTOE]]: ''The DevTeam Thinks of Everything'' – The expression for when you try something strange in NetHack, and the game reacts appropriately.
* [[unihorn]]: ''unicorn horn'' – Important cure. A cursed unihorn is unhelpful for that, but a spare unihorn may help.
* [[WoW]] or /oW: ''wand of wishing'' – Everyone wants this. The WoW in the [[Castle]] is usually termed the "castle wand".
* [[WoY]]: ''Wizard of Yendor'' – More frequently terms for him are "[[Rodney]]" or "the Wizard". The WoY wants the AoY.
* YA...: ''yet another...''
** [[YAAD]]: ''Yet Another Annoying Death'' – Alternative to YASD, when the annoyed player blames the game, not a player's mistake, for the death of the hero.
** [[YAAP]]: ''Yet Another Ascension Post'' – A post to [[RGRN]] announcing that a player won the game.
** [[YAFAP]]: ''Yet Another First Ascension Post'' – A post to RGRN announcing a player's first win.
** [[YAFM]]: ''Yet Another Funny Message'' – Because you did not expect the message, but [[TDTTOE]].
** [[YANC]]: ''Yet Another Newt Comic'' – A ''[[Dudley's dungeon]]'' strip in which a [[newt]] appears and scares (and usually kills) Dudley.
** [[YANI]]: ''Yet Another New Idea'' – A muse to add some feature to NetHack.
** [[YASD]]: ''Yet Another Stupid Death'' – A mistake that causes the death of the hero.
